lead_paragraph: It was also announced that a group representing the state’s 16 medical schools was withdrawing its opposition to a bill that would end the educational use of bodies with no known survivors.

headline.print_headline: City’s 8 Medical Schools Will Stop Using Unclaimed Bodies
headline.main: New York City’s Medical Schools Will Stop Using Unclaimed Bodies

snippet: It was also announced that a group representing the state’s 16 medical schools was withdrawing its opposition to a bill that would end the educational use of bodies with no known survivors....
abstract: Associated Medical Schools of New York announces they will not oppose bill ending educational use of cadavers with no known survivors, ending practice that dates back to 19th century; if signed into law, bill will require written consent from spouse or next of kin to release body to school, unless deceased is registered as body donor.
